attributes.action: SCRAPPING THE MINIMUM WAGE AND OTHER MUCH NEEDED ECONOMIC REFORMS TO GET THE ECONOMY GOING
attributes.additional_details: to scrap the minimum wage, eu working time directive, eu social chapter, scrapping employer based nic or payroll taxes, no forcing employers to fund pension schemes, making the hiring and firing process easier, lowering top tax rates from 50% to 40% or lower if possible, shop owners only pay business rates if they are living in the premises and landlords not having to pay council tax on empty properties and lowering council taxes, scrapping import taxes on food, water, medicines and essential commodities, cutting back on govt subsidies to public and private sectors including to agriculture, slashing useless rules, regulations, red tape, beauracracy and administration in the public and private sectors especially for small businesses, to privatise all the state owned banks and let the banks pay off their debts to the government and get lending again, to stop providing government funding for private mortgages and loans
